'''16w32a''' is the first [[snapshot]] for [[Java Edition 1.11]], released on August 10, 2016.<ref name="blogpost_16w32a">https://www.mojang.com/2016/08/minecraft-snapshot-16w32a/</ref>

== Additions ==
=== Items ===
'''[[Spawn egg]]s'''
* [[File:Zombie Villager Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Zombie villager]] spawn egg
* Eggs that were removed in [[Java Edition 1.10-pre2]] are re-added, except the cat spawn egg, including:
** [[File:Wither Skeleton Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Wither skeleton]] spawn egg
** [[File:Mule Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Mule]] spawn egg
** [[File:Skeleton Horse Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Skeleton horse]] spawn egg
** [[File:Zombie Horse Spawn Egg JE1 BE2.png|32px]] [[Zombie horse]] spawn egg
** [[File:Donkey Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Donkey]] spawn egg
** [[File:Elder Guardian Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Elder guardian]] spawn egg
** [[File:Stray Spawn Egg JE1 BE2.png|32px]] [[Stray]] spawn egg
** [[File:Husk Spawn Egg JE1 BE2.png|32px]] [[Husk]] spawn egg

=== General ===
'''[[Splash]]es'''
* "Javalicious edition"

'''[[Crowdin|Internationalization]]'''
* New strings within the game were made available for internationalization:
** World selection error messages,
** Customized [[superflat]] preset names,
** [[Spectator]]-mode-specific options and messages,
** In the [[Options]] menu: the words "chunks" and "fps",
** In item tooltips: the words "Color: ", "NBT: " and "Durability: ",
** The {{key|F3+Q}} keybindings display text, and text associated with other {{key|[[F3]]}} actions,
** Text associated with downloading [[resource pack]]s from servers.

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[Cauldron]]s'''
* Washing [[dye]]d leather [[armor]] and dyed banners now removes 1 water level from the cauldron.

=== Items ===
'''[[Spawn egg]]s'''
* Are now sorted by name in the Creative inventory.

'''Stacks'''
* There is no longer an item stack of 0 when using the drag function to craft items.

=== Mobs ===
'''[[Creeper]]s'''
* If a creeper is inflicted with a potion effect, its explosion causes a lingering effect of the potion.
* No longer drop music discs when killed by a [[stray]] or [[wither skeleton]].<ref>{{bug|MC-112579}}</ref>

'''[[Husk]]s'''
* Now try to avoid water.

'''[[Snow golem]]s'''
* Now, when their pumpkin is sheared from their head, that is saved with the game (previously it was just an in-memory visual effect).

'''[[Skeleton trap]] horses'''
* The chance of spawning with a thunderstorm lightning strike is reduced to {{frac|1|5}} of what it was.

'''[[Chicken]]s'''
* Some pixels has been added under the head.

'''[[Chat]]'''
* Some warnings now appear above the hotbar instead in the chat, like "Press [key] to dismount" had.
** "You can only sleep at night"
** "You may not rest now, there are monsters nearby"
** "This bed is occupied"
** "Height limit for building is 256 blocks"
** "Unable to open. Loot not generated yet."

=== Command format ===
'''{{cmd|give}}'''
* Now ignores item-specific stacking restrictions.<ref>{{bug|MC-105965}} resolved as "Works as Intended"</ref>

'''[[Block states]]'''
* Block states can now be used in the {{cmd|execute}}, {{cmd|fill}}, {{cmd|setblock}} and {{cmd|testforblock}} [[commands]].
** Examples:
*** <code>/setblock ~ ~ ~ minecraft:stone variant=granite</code> instead of <code>/setblock ~ ~ ~ minecraft:stone 1</code>
*** <code>/setblock ~ ~ ~ wool color=blue</code> instead of <code>/setblock ~ ~ ~ minecraft:wool 11</code>
*** <code>/setblock ~ ~ ~ minecraft:planks variant=acacia</code> instead of <code>/setblock ~ ~ ~ minecraft:planks 4</code>
*** <code>/setblock ~ ~ ~ minecraft:birch_fence_gate facing=west,open=true</code>

=== General ===
'''[[Resource pack]]s'''
* The required pack version number was changed to "3" in <code>pack.mcmeta</code>.
** Version 3 resource packs have to use lowercase filenames for everything.

'''Entity IDs, block entity IDs, block IDs and item IDs'''
* Now are no longer case sensitive.
** Auto-completion puts in lowercase letters.

'''Entity and block entity IDs'''
* Use underscores to separate words, rather than using single words in mixed case.
* Optionally, a <code>minecraft:</code> namespace prefix can be used, just like block and item IDs. However, it is not optional for EntityTags and spawners.<ref>{{bug|MC-106199}} resolved as "Works as Intended"</ref>
* There are still old entity IDs in the language files (example: <code>LavaSlime</code> instead of <code>magma_cube</code> for the [[magma cube]]) and the new mobs in 1.11 have their ID with the old type (no underscores, capital letters for the beginning of the words. example: <code>VindicationIllager</code> instead of <code>vindication_illager</code> for the [[vindicator]].)

|}
* Horse was split into entity IDs <code>horse</code>, <code>donkey</code>, <code>mule</code>, <code>skeleton_horse</code> and <code>zombie_horse</code> for their respective types.
* Skeleton was split into entity IDs <code>skeleton</code>, <code>stray</code> and <code>wither_skeleton</code>.
* Zombie was split into entity IDs <code>zombie</code>, <code>zombie_villager</code> and <code>husk</code>.
* Guardian was split into entity IDs <code>guardian</code> and <code>elder_guardian</code>.
* Unused savegame IDs <code>Mob</code> and <code>Monster</code> were removed, meaning that all references to the first mob added to the game called [[Mob (entity)|Mob]], have been removed.

'''[[NBT format]]'''
* For all horses, <code>HasReproduced</code>, <code>Type</code> and <code>Saddle</code> tags are removed.
* <code>ChestedHorse</code> and <code>Items</code> tags now apply only to <code>mule</code> and <code>donkey</code>.
* <code>SkeletonTrap</code> and <code>SkeletonTrapTime</code> tags now apply only to <code>skeleton_horse</code>.
* <code>Elder</code> tag is removed from <code>guardian</code> and <code>elder_guardian</code>.
* <code>ZombieType</code>, and <code>IsVillager</code> tag is removed from all zombie types.
* <code>ConversionTime</code> and <code>Profession</code> tags now apply only to <code>zombie_villager</code>.
* <code>SkeletonType</code> tag is removed from all skeleton types.
* <code>Pumpkin</code> byte tag is added to <code>snowman</code>.

'''[[Loot table]]s'''
* Donkeys, mules, husks and zombie villagers now each draw from their own loot tables, rather than drawing from the horse and zombie loot tables, respectively.
